Name: AmpR


Description: 
AmpR gene encodes for the beta-lactamase protein that confers resistance against beta-lactam antibiotics (ampicillin, carbenicillin).


Use:
This gene provides bacteria with resistance to ampicillin. This construct is widely used for the selection of transformants.


References for more background:
1. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beta-lactamase
